column1: MRI size (256, 256, 1) in weighting T2, presenting the head of a man of 37 years old, with coronal section. The observation is made on slice n°45 from the back of the skull. The section reveals the presence of: the white matter of left cerebral hemisphere of volume 2759.3262 mm³, the cortex of left cerebral hemisphere of volume 3928.7109 mm³, the left lateral ventricle of volume 180.6152 mm³, the white matter of left hemisphere of cerebellum of volume 461.4258 mm³, the left cerebellar cortex of volume 1733.6426 mm³, the fourth ventricle of volume 271.5820 mm³, the brainstem of volume 508.8867 mm³, the left hippocampus of volume 228.0762 mm³, the white matter of right cerebral hemisphere of volume 2607.7148 mm³, the cortex of right cerebral hemisphere of volume 3981.4453 mm³, the right lateral ventricle of volume 254.4434 mm³, the white matter of right hemisphere of cerebellum of volume 494.3848 mm³, the right cerebellar cortex of volume 1728.3691 mm³ and the right hippocampus of volume 150.2930 mm³.
